participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

INT_01.Description: Sum of scores of items 1-13. Maximum range for raw score for ages 6-8 is 57 and for ages 9-90 is 71.

INT_02.Description: Raw score is converted to T score by age using WASI-II manual conversion tables. Performance reflects the individual’s ability to visually perceive and analyze abstract figures and to construct the whole from the component parts.

INT_03.Description: Sum of scores of items 1-31. Maximum range for raw score for age 6 is 41, for ages 7-11 is 47, for ages 12-14 is 53, and for ages 15-90 is 59.

INT_04.Description: Raw score is converted to T score by age using WASI-II manual conversion tables. Performance reflects the individual’s verbal knowledge and fund of information.

INT_05.Description: Sum of scores of items 1-30. Maximum range for raw score for ages 6-8 is 24 and for ages 9-90 is 30.

INT_06.Description: Raw score is converted to T score by age using WASI-II manual conversion tables. Performance reflects the individual’s ability to mentally manipulate abstract symbols and to perceive the relationships among them.

INT_07.Description: Sum of scores of items 1-24. Maximum range for raw score for ages 6-8 is 41, and for ages 9-90 is 45.

INT_08.Description: Raw score is converted to T score by age using WASI-II manual conversion tables. Performance reflects the individual’s ability to see relationships between objects or concepts and to generalize the relationships into a single concept.

INT_09.LongName: Verbal Comp. Sum of T Scores
INT_09.Description: Sum of Vocabulary and Similarities T scores.

INT_10.LongName: Perc. Rsng. Sum of T Scores
INT_10.Description: Sum of Block Design and Matrix Reasoning T scores.

INT_11.LongName: Full Scale-4 Sum of T scores
INT_11.Description: Sum of Vocabulary, Similarities, Block Design and Matrix Reasoning T scores.

INT_12.Description: Measure of acquired knowledge, verbal reasoning, and attention to verbal information. Sum of Vocabulary and Similarities T scores is converted to a Verbal Composite Index score by age using the WASI-II conversion tables. The distribution of composite scores for each WASI-II scale has a mean of 100 and a standard deviation of 15.

INT_13.Description: Measure of fluid reasoning, spatial processing, attentiveness to detail, and visual-motor integration. Sum of Block Design and Matrix Reasoning T scores is converted to a Perceptual Reasoning Index score by age using the WASI-II conversion tables. The distribution of composite scores for each WASI-II scale has a mean of 100 and a standard deviation of 15.

INT_14.Description: Estimate of general cognitive ability. Sum of T scores for Block Design, Matrix Reasoning Vocabulary, and Similarities sub tests is converted to FSIQ-4 score using the WASI-II conversion tables. Descriptive classifications of FSIQ-4 score ranges: 130 and above = very superior; 120-129 = superior; 110-119 = high average; 90-109 = average; 80-89 = low average; 70-79 = borderline; 69 and below = extremely low.

INT_15.Description: Percentage of VCI composite scores that are the same or lower than individual’s score based on the WASI-II conversion tables.

INT_16.Description: Percentage of PRI composite scores that are the same or lower than individual’s score based on the WASI-II conversion tables.

INT_17.Description: Percentage of FSIQ-4 scores that are the same or lower than individual’s score based on the WASI-II conversion tables.
